info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 09 at 5:09AM EST until January 10 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, wintry mix including freezing rain, sleet and some snow expected. Total sleet and snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy lake effect snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Southern Herkimer County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 PM EST this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from this evening through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Untreated ground surfaces will be treacherous due to ice accumulation today. Lake effect snow could impact the thruway after Midnight tonight into Monday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...During the lake effect snow tonight into Monday morning, snowfall rates may reach 0.50 to 1 inch per hour at times.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
